newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan bank shares fall on health jitters.
newsitem.headline: Japan bank shares fall on health jitters.

text.p: Japanese bank shares faltered in Tuesday morning trade, as uncertainties over the financial health of the bank sector preyed on the minds of investors, brokers said.
Brokers said that rather than futures linked-selling, a barrage of small-lot selling was depressing the shares.
As of 0038 GMT Industrial Bank of Japan Ltd shares were down 40 yen at 1,220. Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi Ltd shed 80 yen to stand at 1,850. Sumitomo Bank Ltd fell 60 yen to 1,410.

"Now that the new business year has started, institutional investors may step up their dissolution of cross-shareholdings and the banking sector is one of the areas which will be hit worst," a broker at a major securities house said.

Brokers added that, amid the recent flood of announcements of rescue plans for firms burdened with problem loans, investors were taking a cautious stance and were waiting to see how the plans are carried out.
